meanings.definition: (ラテン語)承認しない、非難する、拒否する

examples.translation: 元老院はその計画を承認しない。
examples.english_translation: The Senate disapproves of the plan.

etymology.value: in- (否定の接頭辞) + probare (試す、承認する)

verb_forms.present_active: improbo, improbas, improbat, improbamus, improbatis, improbant
verb_forms.imperfect_active: improbabam, improbabas, improbabat, improbabamus, improbabatis, improbabant
verb_forms.future_active: improbabo, improbabis, improbabit, improbabimus, probabitis, probabunt
verb_forms.perfect_active: improbavi, improbasisti, improidavit, improbavimus, improbavistis, improbaverunt
verb_forms.pluperfect_active: improbaveram, improbaveras, improbaverat, improbaveramus, improbaveratis, improbaverant
verb_forms.future_perfect_active: improbavero, improbaveris, improbaverit, improbaverimus, improbaveritis, improbaverint
verb_forms.present_passive: improbor, probaris, probatur, probamur, probamini, probantur
verb_forms.imperfect_passive: improbabar, probabaris, probabatur, probabamur, probabamini, probabantur
verb_forms.future_passive: improbabor, probaberis, probabitur, probabimur, probabimini, probabuntur

usage_notes.explanation: ラテン語の動詞で、現代語の「非難する」「承認しない」に相当します。

derivatives: improbatus (形容詞: 承認されない)
